17F041122-d-04-22-11-GRW.Narrative: -MAN REMOTE CONTROL ASSIGNMENT DERAILED GRW 7667 AND GRW 7112 WHILE SHOVING TWELVE EMPTY COVERED COIL CARS TOWARDS TRACK 57S. THE CREW LINED THE SWITCH FOR THEIR ROUTE AND BEGAN A NORTH SHOVING MOVEMENT. THE RCO YARD FOREMAN WAS POSITIONED ON THE LEADING END OF THE POINT CAR, AND WAS CONTROLLING MOVEMENT. THE RCO SWITCHMAN WAS POSITIONED IN LOCOMOTIVE GRW 321 (THE TRAILING ENGINE OF A TWO ENGINE CONSIST) ON THE WEST SIDE, IN THE SEAT OPPOSITE THE ENGINEER SEAT. THE MOVEMENT CONTINUED FOR APPROXIMATELY 998 FEET TOWARD TRACK 57 ‘S’. AS THE MOVEMENT STARTED AROUND A WESTWARD CURVE ONTO TRACK 57STHE RCO SWITCHMAN IN GRW 321 OBSERVED A GAP BETWEEN TWO RAILCARS AND IMMEDIATELY INSTRUCTED THE RCOYARD FOREMAN TO BRING MOVEMENT TO A STOP. THE MOVEMENT CONTINUED WITH ONLY THE ONE AXLE OF GRW 7667DERAILED UNTIL IT REACHED THE 57S SWITCH, WHICH WAS LINED FOR 57S. THE LEADING EIGHT CARS AND THE LEADING TRUCK OF GRW 7667 TRAVELED ONTO TRACK 57S.  THE LEADING AXLE OF THE TRAILING TRUCK CONTINUED STRAIGHT ON THE 2S LEAD, CAUSING THE TRUCK TO COMPLETELY DERAIL. THE 10TH CAR FROM LEADING END (GRW 7112) FOLLOWED THE TRACK TOWARDS 57S AND SEPARATED THE LEADING TRUCK FROM THE CAR BODY.

0411RS019-d-04-30-11-UP.Narrative: APPROACHING SWITCH 769 CREW OBSERVED SWITCH TARGET TO DISPLAY THE 1/2 GREEN FACE FOR THE STRAIGHT TRACK MOVEMENT.  PULLING ACROSS SWITCH THE LEAD TRUCK OF THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE DERAILED AND THE FOLLOWING LOCOMOTIVES TRAVELED UP THE DIVERGING ROUTE COMING TO A STOP 210 FEET PAST THE SWITCH POINTS.  EVIDENCE SHOWS THAT THE LEFT LEADING WHEEL PASSED BEHIND THE LEFT SWITCH POINT WHICH WAS NOT FULLY AGAINST THE STOCK RAIL, THROWING THE SWITCH TO THE DIVERGING ROUTE.  CREW FOUND THIS SWITCH LINED AGAINST THEIR MOVEMENT WHEN DEPARTING THE DAY PRIOR AND DEPARTED OVER THIS SWITCH IN THE STRAIGHT RAIL POSITION.  IT WAS CONCLUDED THAT THE SWITCH HAD BEEN TAMPERED WITH BETWEEN THE TIME THE LRS56S-29 DEPARTED AND THE TIME THE SAME CREW RETURNED ON THE LRS57S-30 LEAVING SWITCH IN A PARTIALLY THROWN POSITION THAT WAS NOT VISIBLE FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE CAB BY LOOKING AT EITHER THE SWITCH TARGET OR THE SWITCHPOINTS.  TRAIN WAS TRAVELING OVER MAXIMUM SPEED FOR TRACK CLASS AT TIME OF INCIDENT.

THE CREW WAS TOLD TO SWITCH OUT THE 2 UNITS AND TAKE THEM BACK TO COLTON.  THE CREW SWITCHED OUT THE 2 UNITS FROM A 6-UNIT CONSIST AND WERE DOING A CONSIST TEST.  DURING THE TIME THEY WERE DOING THE TEST, THE CLERK HAD ANOTHER CREW GO INTO THE PMT AND GET TRACK 568 TO PUT IN THE AYARD.  THE CLERK DID NOT TELL THE YC120 CREW THERE WAS A CREW SWITCHING POWER AND WOULD BE COMING OUT TO GO TO COLTON BEHIND THEM.  THE YC120 SWITCH CREW PUT THE WEST END DERAIL IN DERAILING POSITIONAFTER LEAVING 568 TRACK AND DID NOT TALK TO THE LIGHT POWER CREW.  THE LIGHT POWER CREW CAME OUT OFTHE PMT EXPECTING THE DERAIL TO BE IN THE NONDERAILING POSITION AND DERAILED TWO WHEELS ON THEIR REAR UNIT AS THEY WERE SHOVING OUT OF THE PMT.  NO TRACK DAMAGE.

0411SA005-d-04-05-11-UP.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, absence of man on or at leading end of movement

0411SA005-d-04-05-11-UP.Narrative: BNSF DELIVERED TRAIN MTLEGJ-04 TO FXE CREW ON THE BRIDGE USING TRACK 613.  WHEN FXE ARRIVED TO PULLTRAIN, THEY REQUESTED PERMISSION FROM US CUSTOMS TO COMBINE BNSF TRAIN WITH A CUT OF 9 CARS FROM INTERCHANGE YARD.  US CUSTOMS GRANTED PERMISSION.  FXE CREW CUT AWAY AND HAD BNSF SWITCH CREW LINE SWITCHES NEEDED FOR THEIR MOVEMENTS.  ONCE FXE HAD COUPLED BOTH CUTS TOGETHER THEY PROCEEDED INTO MEXICO.  US CUSTOMS HAD ONLY GIVEN PERMISSION TO MAKE INITIAL MOVE TO COMBINE THE CUTS FOR INTERCHANGE, NOT FOR MOVEMENTS INTO MEXICO.  REALIZING WHAT FXE WAS DOING US CUSTOMS CONTACTED THE CREW AND INSTRUCTED THEM TO STOP THEIR MOVEMENT.  THEY NOTIFIED CREW THAT THEY HAD NOT BEEN GIVEN PERMISSION TO PROCEED  AND THEY NEEDED TO BACK UP CLEAR OF THE XRAY MACHINE FOR INSPECTION.  CREW CONTACTED BNSF INTERCHANGE OFFICE AND REQUESTED ASSISTANCE IN PROTECTING THE SHOVING MOVEMENT TO COMPLY WITH INSTRUCTIONS FROM US CUSTOMS.  AT THAT TIME A BNSF CLERK FROM INTERCHANGE OFFICE POSITIONED HIMSELF USING A VEHICLE TO PROTECT THE SHOVING MOVEMENT.  CONTROL OF MOVEMENT WAS DONE WITH AN ADDITIONAL BNSF CLERK INSIDE INTERCHANGE OFFICE THAT HAD RADIO COMMUNICATION WITH FXE RELAYING INFORMATION.  PERSON PROTECTING SHOVE DID NOT REALIZE THAT TRAIN HAD SHOVED THROUGH THE 610/611 SWITCH.  ONCE THE HEAD END OF THETRAIN HAD REACHED THE REQUIRED STARTING POINT FOR THE US CUSTOMS INSPECTION THE CREW STOPPED MOVEMENT. 13F041121-d-04-06-11-GRW.Narrative: REMOTE TIN MILL CREW CONSISTING OF AN RCO FOREMAN AND HELPER, OPERATING GRW 324-310 DERAILED FOUR (4) LOADED COIL CARS AT SWITCH CROSSOVER 14S LEAD TO 2S LEAD. THE CREW WAS IN THE PROCESS OF PULLING 20 LOADED COIL CARS SOUTHBOUND FROM PROTEC YARD FOR HEADROOM IN ORDER TO SHOVE THE 20 CARS NORTH INTOTRACK 6S. THE RCO FOREMAN OPERATED SWITCH CROSSOVER 14S LEAD TO 2S LEAD, WITHOUT EXCEPTION, LININGTHE ROUTE FOR 2S LEAD. THE RCO FOREMAN THEN POSITIONED HIMSELF AT THE FACING SWITCH (SWITCH 2S-14S)IN ORDER TO LINE THIS SWITCH TOWARDS 6S ONCE THE 20 CAR CONSIST CLEARED THIS SWITCH. THE HELPER WASCONTROLLING THE MOVEMENT WHILE RIDING ON THE SOUTH END OF GRW 324 TO PROVIDE POINT PROTECTION. THE GRW 324-310 AND SIX (6) CARS TRAVELED SOUTH OVER SWITCH 14S LEAD TO 2S LEAD WITHOUT INCIDENT. THE SEVENTH THROUGH TENTH CARS (EJE 7014, CSXT 495659, NYC 628215 AND CSXT 496202) DERAILED AT SWITCH 14S LEAD TO 2S LEAD. THE CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE A BROKEN SWITCH POINT. RUST ON THE BROKEN POINT SHOWSIT HAD A EXISTING HORIZONTAL CRACK STARTING TWO INCHES BACK FROM THE POINT.THE END TWO INCHES BROKEAS THE LOADED CARS WERE MOVING ACROSS IT. AS RESULT OF THE DERAILMENT, SWITCH CROSSOVER 14S/2S, SWITCH CROSSOVER 2S/14S AND SWITCH 18S SUSTAINED DAMAGED RAIL, SWITCH POINTS,A FROG AND SEVERAL SWITCHTIES. THE RCO FOREMAN OBSERVED THE DERAILMENT FROM HIS POSITION AT SWITCH 2S-14S AND INSTRUCTED THEHELPER TO STOP THE MOVEMENT. THE DERAILED CARS TRAVELED APPROXIMATELY168FT BEFORE COMING TO A STOP.

CREW THEN STARTED SHOVING CARS NORTH. FOREMAN AND TRAINEE WERE ON THE LEADING CAR OF THE SHOVE, AND HELPER WAS ON THE REAR OF THE TRAIN ONTHE LOCOMOTIVE GRW 324. AS THEY WERE SHOVING CARS NORTH, THE 8TH CAR FROM THE NORTH, GRW 6913 "B" END OF CAR FACING NORTH, DIDN'T SWIVEL AS IT WENT THROUGH A CURVED SECTION OF TRACK. THE TRUCK APPEARED TO BE FIXED AND WANTED TO TRAVEL STRAIGHT, INSTEAD OF GO THROUGH THE CURVED SECTION OF THE RAIL. THE EAST WHEELS RODE 11 INCHES PAST THE EAST POINT AND WALKED UP ON THE POINT AND TRAVELED ON TOP OFTHE RAIL UNTIL THEY FELL OFF THE RAIL AND DERAILED.

CONDUCTOR WAS THAT THE LAST 2 CARS, GATX 10817 & CN 415412, WERE DERAILED. THERE WERE NO LEAKS OR EXPOSURE. BRAKEMAN WASTESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE. INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT THE BRAKEMAN SAW THE DERAIL THAT HAD BEEN PLACED ON THE TRACK BY CSXT TRACK FORCES, WITHOUT ADVISING THE RAILROAD, ANDFAILED TO STOP THE MOVEMENT SHORT OF THE DERAIL.

0411PD014-d-04-25-11-UP.Narrative: CREW PULLED 17 CARS FROM THE WEST END OF TRACK 16 UP ONTO THE LEAD SO THEY COULD SET A TRAIN IN TRACK 21.  THEY PULLED ONTO THE  LEAD FAR ENOUGH TO CLEAR THE CIRCUIT FOR THE 21 POCKET SWITCH WHICH ISA RADIO LINED SWITCH FOR RCL JOBS.  AFTER LINING SWITCH BY RADIO, THEY DID NOT RECEIVE A CONFIRMATION BROADCAST FOR DISPOSITION OF SWITCH.  THE CREW THEN, BY RADIO, DID AN INQUIRY OF SWITCH POSITION.THE SWITCH THEN DID BROADCAST THAT IT WAS IN THE REVERSE POSITION LINED FOR THEIR INTENDED ROUTE.THE SWITCHMAN THEN STARTED THE MOVEMENT BACK EAST TO SHOVE INTO TRACK 21.  THE LEAD CARS FIRST SET OF TRUCKS WENT TOWARDS TRACK 16 AND THE REST OF THE CARS WENT TOWARD TRACK 21.

000087858-d-04-16-11-CSX.Narrative: Y19216 COUPLED B04 TRACK TO BE SET OUT FOR AN OUTBOUND TRAIN. THE RC FOREMAN WALKED THE ENTIRE TRACKAND VERIFIED THAT THE CARS WERE ON THE TRACK, THE COUPLINGS WERE MADE AND THE CARS MATCHED THE TRACK LIST THAT WAS ISSUED TO HIM. Y19116 DOUBLED B06, TO B05, TO B04 AND BEGAN TO PULL THE CUT OF CARSNORTH. AS THE REAR END OF THE CUT OF CARS APPROACHED THE NORTH END OF THE TRACK THE TRACK BEGAN TO GET HARDER TO PULL AND THE RC FOREMAN NOTICED DUST COMING FROM THE REAR END OF THE CUT OF CARS. THE CREW STOPPED THE MOVEMENT AND INVESTIGATED THE SITUATION AND FOUND THAT THE 11 SOUTH CARS IN B04 HADDERAILED ABOUT 15 CAR LENGTHS SOUTH OF THE INERT RETARDER ON STRAIGHT TRACK. THE INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT A BROKEN RAIL HAD CAUSED THE DERAILMENT.

1104221-d-04-24-11-MMA.Maintenance Railroad Name: Montreal, Maine and Atlantic Railway, Ltd.
1104221-d-04-24-11-MMA.Contributing Accident Cause: Cross level of track irregular (not at joints)
1104221-d-04-24-11-MMA.Narrative: NO 120 IN PROGRESS OF PERFORMING PULL BY RELEASE OF 8 LOADS 3 EMPTIES AT EASTON WHEN 7TH, 8TH, 9TH,10TH AND 11TH CARS DERAILED ROLLING ONTO THEIR SIDES ON WEST SIDE OF TRACK.  CAUSE OF DERAILMENT ISBELIEVED TO BE FAILURE OF NORTH TRUCK (TRAILING) A END OF GATX 94662 FUEL OIL TO SWIVEL PROPERLY INSLIGHT LEFT CURVE HEADING INTO SWITCH SPREADING RAIL ALLOWING SOUTH END LEADING WHEEL (EAST SIDE) OFFOLLOWING CAR GATX 81599 FUEL OIL TO DROP IN.  DERAILED CARS BROKE RAIL ON WEST SIDE OF TRACK CAUSING OUTSIDE (WEST SIDE) WHEELS TO TRACK AWAY AND DOWN ALLOWING CARS TO ROLL.  DOUBLE SHELF COUPLERS INCREASED SEVERITY OF DERAILMENT PULLING THREE EXTRA CARS ONTO THEIR SIDES.  SPEED OF TRAIN 7 MPH. THROTTLE NOTCH 1, BRAKES IN RELEASE POSITION.  INSPECTION OF TRUCK AND WHEELS ON GATX 94662 SHOWED NOOBVIOUS DEFECTS.  SLIGHT DEVIATION IN CROSS LEVEL OF TRACK AT POINT OF DERAILMENT LESS THAN 1 INCH HOWEVER THIS DEVIATION IS WITHIN FRA SPECS FOR CLASS OF TRACK.  TWO FUEL OIL CARS DRIPPED PRODUCT FROM MANWAY COVER AS FOLLOWS: GATX 53838 FUEL OIL MANWAY BOLTS WERE TIGHTENED BY FIRE DEPT. STOPPING LEAK ENTIRELY (5 GAL LOSS).  FIRE DEPT. WAS UNABLE TO STOP LEAKING FROM GATX 81599 FUEL OIL WHICH CONTINUED DRIPPING UNTIL TANK WAS TRANSLOADED (100 GAL LOSS).  DRIPPING PRODUCT WAS CONTAINED BY USE OFPADS AND CONTAINERS.  CAUSE OF DERAILMENT IS A COMBINATION OFTRUCK FAILING TO SWIVEL AND SLIGHT CROSSLEVEL DEVIATION OF TRACK.   TRAIN HANDLING WAS RULED OUT AS A CONTRIBUTING CAUSE.
